Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java utility class for making HTTP requests using OkHttp library, supporting GET and POST methods with configurable headers, parameters, and retry mechanism.

Class Description: HttpUtil is a utility class that provides static methods for making HTTP requests. It handles both GET and POST requests with support for headers, query parameters, and form parameters. The class includes built-in timeout settings and a retry mechanism for failed requests.

Attributes:
- QUESTION_SEPARATE: String - Constant for URL question mark separator
- PARAM_SEPARATE: String - Constant for URL parameter separator
- KV_SEPARATE: String - Constant for key-value separator in URLs
- client: OkHttpClient - Pre-configured HTTP client instance with timeout settings

Methods:
- doGet(String url) -> Resp - Executes a GET request to the specified URL
- doGetWithHeader(String url, Map<String, String> headers) -> Resp - Executes a GET request with custom headers
- doGet(String url, Map<String, String> params) -> Resp - Executes a GET request with URL parameters
- doPost(String url) -> Resp - Executes a POST request to the specified URL
- doPost(String url, Map<String, String> params) -> Resp - Executes a POST request with form parameters
- executeRequest(Request request, int retryTime) -> Resp - Internal method to execute requests with retry logic
- bodyToString(ResponseBody body) -> String - Helper method to convert response body to string

Nested Class: Resp
- Description: Represents the HTTP response with status code, body, and optional message
- Attributes:
  - code: int - HTTP status code
  - body: String - Response body content
  - message: String - Optional message (used for errors)
- Methods:
  - builder() -> RespBuilder - Creates a new RespBuilder instance
  - getCode() -> int - Returns the status code
  - getBody() -> String - Returns the response body
  - getMessage() -> String - Returns the message

Nested Class: RespBuilder
- Description: Builder pattern implementation for constructing Resp objects
- Methods:
  - code(int code) -> RespBuilder - Sets the status code
  - body(String body) -> RespBuilder - Sets the response body
  - message(String message) -> RespBuilder - Sets the message
  - build() -> Resp - Constructs the Resp object
